abstract: ABC’s “Desperate Housewives” delivered Sunday’s top ratings, as the closing minutes of the plot-twisting series’ fourth season gave viewers a brief flash-forward five years into the future. According to Nielsen’s estimates, the two-hour finale attracted 16.8 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., in line with its performance this spring but down two million from its third season finale a year ago.

lead_paragraph: ABC’s “Desperate Housewives” delivered Sunday’s top ratings, as the closing minutes of the plot-twisting series’ fourth season gave viewers a brief flash-forward five years into the future. According to Nielsen’s estimates, the two-hour finale attracted 16.8 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., in line with its performance this spring but down two million from its third season finale a year ago.
